meaningMnemonic: This is a single kanji with しい on the end, meaning it's an adjective. What's the adjective form of <kanji>busy</kanji>? It's also <vocabulary>busy</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic: You're <vocabulary>busy</vocabulary> because you have to take care of your friend's <reading>ice ogre</reading>s (いそが) this weekend. You don't know why you agreed to this, you were busy enough, but now you'll never get anything done running around taking care of these little ice ogres.
